definitions.definition: excessive pride in or admiration of one's own appearance or achievements.
examples: it flattered his vanity to think I was in love with him
synonyms: rodomontade; informalbig-headedness; literaryvainglory "she had none of the vanity often associated with beautiful women"

definitions.definition: denoting a person or company that publishes works at the author's expense.
the quality of being worthless or futile.
synonyms: fruitlessness "the vanity of all desires of the will"

definitions.definition: a bathroom unit consisting of a washbasin typically set into a counter with a cabinet beneath.
